snippet: The Supreme Court’s five conservatives have gutted a generation of careful, court-made law used to address abuses abroad.
abstract: Editorial criticizes Supreme Court's five conservative justices for gutting ability of American federal courts to hold violators of international human rights accountable by declaring that 1789 law does not allow foreigners to sue in American courts to seek redress.
lead_paragraph: The Supreme Court’s five conservatives have gutted a generation of careful, court-made law used to address abuses abroad.

headline.seo: The Supreme Court’s Setback for Human Rights
headline.main: A Giant Setback for Human Rights
headline.print_headline: A Giant Setback for Human Rights

keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
keywords.name: subject
